Key Arguments: The legislation threatens democracy by potentially censoring discourse that contradicts government narratives.
The government should not be the arbiter of truth and should not determine what can or cannot be said.
The legislation is seen as anti-democratic and totalitarian.
There is a need for specific legislation targeting foreign interference without affecting general discourse.
Notable Quotes: This is one of the most concerning Bills I have ever been aware of.
The whole idea of this legislation is an anti-Australian, anti-democratic, totalitarian disgrace.
